reviews.text: If you are comfortable driving through town, and are a good navigator, this is a possible option for weekend visits to Niagara Falls. Check closing time for restaurant in advance if you are planning to eat when you return.
reviews.title: Drive a little, save a lot.

reviews.text: The general manager of the Buffalo Marriott (the one on Millersport Highway near SUNY Buffalo's Amherst campus) needs to go to hotel school or something because he is running a wreck.
reviews.title: Mismanagement of the Buffalo Marriott Niagara on Millersport Highway

reviews.text: Here are the facts:
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: 1) His front desk staff quoted my family and I $140 (per room, per night) but charged us $180 without verifying the charge. Worse, they did this on a LATE NIGHT check-in. I did not discover the over-bill until it was too late. I cannot prove that the hotel regularly takes advantage of weary travelers but it certainly did in this case.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: 2) The manager's staff did not advise us that the hotel was doing construction on our floor or that the hot tub was out of order. They also promised to send around a luggage cart but never did, forcing me to walk through the construction zone to retrieve it myself.
reviews.title: Bad AC, thin walls

reviews.text: We were there for a wedding and it was great to all be located in the same area as other wedding guests. The room was fine but the cot that they brought in had stains on the sheets and the towels in the bathroom also had stains on them. I told one of the housekeepers but the sheets were not changed for the second night! The location was fine. There are about 5 other hotels all in the same area!
reviews.title: Typical Marriott experience

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at this Marriott. It was easy to find, the rooms were clean, the beds were soft and the staff was very friendly. Having the indoor/outdoor pool was a big plus as it was a beautiful day to be outside. My son loved swimming in the pool(s). Our room was on the first floor and we could walk right out to the pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a one night stay. It was perfect for us!
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A chain hotel I am increasingly disappointed in. This was not as nice as expected. Seemed to be clean but was shocked to find a used floss under the phone. When shown to the front desk, they apologized, but no further action taken. Beds not very comfortable. Otherwise OK. Was extremely upset to see the American flag displayed outside on the same level as the Canadian flag. The flag of the USA is always to be higher than other flags when displayed in the this country.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected.

reviews.text: We stayed at this Marriott as our son was in town for a hockey tournament. We found the staff to be very friendly at check-in and they provided useful information regarding shopping and restaurants in the area. The room was large and the beds were comfortable. Both of my children loved the pool and spent most of their off time swimming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room at the Marriott since I am a Gold Marriott Reward holder. We decided to stay in Buffalo and drive to Niagara Falls since the hotels near the falls were pricey.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: We were given a room on the 10th floor. I noticed some renovations being done in the lobby area but not on our floor. Our room was extremely comfortable and clean. The bathroom seemed small but in comparison with the size of the room. Great service by the housekeeping staff. We arrived on Friday and left on Monday. The lounge opened on Sunday night with cheese and crackers, fruit, chips, soda and then later they had strawberry cheesecake and carrot cake. On Monday morning, the lounge was open with eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, danish and juice.
reviews.title: Plastic Covered Mattress

reviews.text: We did not use the pool but it was crowded on Friday night. I think there must have been a girls softball team staying at the hotel. We did see alot of girls in uniforms. The hotel has an outside and indoor pool.
reviews.title: Won't stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: Okay, I admit, I hate plastic covered mattresses. I don't get a good night's sleep on them as I wake up sweating throughout the night. I had only run into them at cheap hotels that are trying to save on their costs before the Buffalo Niagara Marriott. Now I had stayed at the this property multiple times over the past 10 years and always liked it: great location, good sized rooms, helpful staff. But for this weekend trip, after the first night of sleeplessness on plastic, I discovered the plastic mattress cover. So I called the front desk to ask them to take it off and they told me that housekeeping would do so. When I got back to the room late that night and found the plastic still there I called down to the desk. I heard "Housekeeping isn't allowed to remove the plastic as it protects against bed bugs." I explained that I had stayed in Marriotts all around the world and had never experienced a plastic-coated bed, and that the bed was quite uncomfortable. Desk staff said there was nothing they could do about it. I checked out early and won't stay there again. I did email the manager following this and was told that I was given wrong information. Well, if he was right then the staff really messed up (two different desk shifts ignoring a guest request????)
reviews.title: Do NOT stay here!

reviews.text: What an amazing value, super location & the staff is to be commended, they are so nice! I've stayed here four times, using the "park & fly" w/ the free airport shuttle & it's always worry- free & relaxing. Thank you!
